metadata.title: Increasing papers' discoverability with precise semantic labeling: The sci.AI platform
metadata.abstract: © 2017 The authors and IOS Press. The number of published findings in biomedicine increases continually. At the same time, specifics of the domain's terminology complicates the task of relevant publications retrieval. In the current research, we investigate influence of terms' variability and ambiguity on a paper's likelihood of being retrieved. We obtained statistics that demonstrate significance of the issue and its challenges, followed by presenting the sci.AI platform, which allows precise terms labeling as a resolution.
metadata.journal: Expanding Perspectives on Open Science: Communities, Cultures and Diversity in Concepts and Practices - Proceedings of the 21st International Conference on Electronic Publishing

description:
sci.AI is a free platform that “understands” research papers and “explains” them to analytics and search algorithms.  

The platform takes all biomedical papers, trials, and projects and interlinks research findings in a semantic graph. Then, it mimics human reasoning to return discovered pathways and support research
name: sci.AI
